intro: Cyclorhiza waltonii var. major, commonly known as the large-flowered cyclorhiza, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a contrasting throat. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
